After
change media and allow cells to recover
Once cells have reached 80-90% confluency, split culture as single cells into 3 wells of a 6 well tissue culture plate.

of PBS

Add
of Accutase per well

Incubate cells and Accutase at
for

Rock Inhibitor and plate
into each freshly coated Matrigel well

at
Perform the single cell passage (Step 12) at least two additional times prior to using cells for Nucleofection

prior to nucleofection

source.body: You will need three million cells per nucleofection and one million cells per GFP control. Therefore, three wells of a confluent of a 6-well tissue culture plate are sufficient

source.description: Split cells for nucleofection
Aspirate media from cells

Wash each well with
of PBS and aspirate

Add
of Accutase per well

Incubate at
for

Collect cells in
of PBS and transfer to a 15ml conical tube

Resuspend cell pellet in
of PBS in the 15ml conical tube, then dilute cells 1:10 (
of cell suspension +
of PBS) in a 1.7ml tube

Use
of diluted cells for cell counts
Using all four corners of the countess slide, calculate the average number of cells
Multiply the average by 10,000 (104)

Multiply product from step 20.2 by 3 to get the total number of cells
[Average # of Cells x 10,000 x 3] = Total Number of Cells
Take total number of cells calculated in step 20.3 and divide by three million
Take answer from step 20.4 and divide by three to get the volume of cells necessary for nucleofection
Transfer the desired volume of cells (calculated in step 20.5) to microcentrifuge tube
Aspirate PBS from cell pellet

source.title: Prepare Lonza Kit Reagents for Nucleofection

source.description:
Make reaction mix from Lonza Kit: P3 Primary Cell 4D (V4XP-3024). Each reaction requires a total of
of reaction mix.

source.body: If performing more than one reaction, it is best to make a Master Mix

source.title: Combining Lonza Kit Reagents and DNA for Nucleofection

source.description: Mix reaction mix and DNA with cell pellets (step 23) by pipetting up and down with p200 pipette

source.body: Try to pipette as little as possible. Pipette only until mixed

source.title: Combining Lonza Kit Reagents and DNA for Nucleofection

source.description:
Transfer
of reaction mix + DNA + cells to a cuvette

source.body: Ensure no bubbles are in the transferred mixture of cells in the cuvette. This can interfere with the nucleofection's success

source.description: Nucleofect with Lonza Program CA-137 in P3 Solution

Let cuvette and cells incubate for
at

Transfer cells/DNA solution to approproate pre-coated well containing
of DMEM/F12 + 10% FBS +
Rock Inhibitor

Incubate at
overnight
Continue culturing the iPSC in 1 well of a 6 well plate for 5-7 days post nucleofection, changing mTesR1 daily.
